page.title: 05ASHDON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The church of All Saints stands at the top of Church Hill,almost a mile from the present village centre.Around the church the early village settlement was grouped.Although it is possible that a church existed as early as the 10th C.the earliest part of the existing structure,the chancel dates back to 13th C.Other parts were added or rebuilt during the 14th,15th,16th 18th,19th and 20th Centuries. The walls are built of flints (probably collected from the fields), and there are dressings of clunch and limestone around windows and doors. Some brick was added in the 15th and 16th Centuries.The roof of the nave and chancel is tiled but the flat roofs of the aisle and vestry are covered in lead.The present rector of Ashdon (and neighbouring Hadstock) is the Rev Claude Riches.He holds three
